serverAllocations.title: Allocations
serverAllocations.description: Manage your server's network allocations and ports.
serverAllocations.noAllocationPermission: You do not have permission to manage server allocations.
serverAllocations.allocationStatusDescription: You are currently using {current} of {limit} allowed allocations for this server.
serverAllocations.noAllocationsDescription: This server doesn't have any network allocations yet. You can create custom allocations or use auto-allocation to automatically assign available free allocations.
serverAllocations.confirmDeleteDescription: Are you sure you want to delete this allocation? This action cannot be undone.
serverAllocations.confirmSetPrimaryDescription: Are you sure you want to set this allocation as primary? This will become the main connection for your server.
serverAllocations.selectAllocationDescription: Choose a specific allocation to assign, or select "Auto" to randomly assign one.
serverAllocations.noAvailableAllocations: No available allocations found on this node.
serverAllocations.searchAllocations: Search by IP, port, alias, or notes...

tickets.title: Support Tickets
tickets.viewAndManage: View and manage your support tickets
tickets.createFirstTicket: Create your first ticket to get help
tickets.deleteTicketConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this ticket?
tickets.createTicketDescription: Fill out the form below to create a new support ticket
tickets.serverHint: If this issue is related to a specific server
tickets.categoryDescription: Select the category that best describes your issue.
tickets.priorityDescription: Choose the urgency of your request.
tickets.fillRequiredFields: Please fill in all required fields
tickets.ticketClosed: This ticket is closed. You can no longer reply.
tickets.deleteMessageConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this message?

eula.title: Accept Minecraft EULA
eula.description: The Minecraft EULA must be accepted to run this server.
eula.eulaMessage: By changing the setting below to TRUE you are indicating your agreement to our EULA.
eula.eulaExplanation: The Minecraft End User License Agreement (EULA) contains the rules you must follow when running a Minecraft server.
eula.failedToStartServer: Failed to auto-start server. Please start it manually.

javaVersion.title: Java Version Incompatibility Detected
javaVersion.description: The server detected an incorrect Java version.
javaVersion.recommendation: We detected that your server requires a different Java version than what is currently selected.

pidLimit.title: Process Limit Reached
pidLimit.description: Your server has reached the maximum number of allowed processes.
pidLimit.explanation: This usually happens when plugins or mods spawn too many threads or subprocesses, or if the server has been running for a long time with a memory leak.
pidLimit.suggestion1: Restart your server to clear stuck processes
pidLimit.suggestion2: Check your plugins for known issues with thread usage

serverActivities.title: Server Activity
serverActivities.description: View the audit logs for this server.
serverActivities.noActivityPermission: You do not have permission to view server activities.

details.description: Detailed information about this server event.

serverActivities.noActivitiesDescription: This server has no recorded activity yet.
serverActivities.noActivitiesSearchDescription: Try adjusting your search query or filters to find what you are looking for.

serverDatabases.title: Databases
serverDatabases.description: Manage databases and database users for this server
serverDatabases.noDatabasePermission: You do not have permission to manage server databases.
serverDatabases.createDatabaseDescription: Create a new database and user on a database host
serverDatabases.databaseNameHelp: The name of the database to create
serverDatabases.remoteAccessHelp: Host pattern for remote access (e.g., % for any host)
serverDatabases.maxConnectionsHelp: Maximum number of concurrent connections (0 for unlimited)
serverDatabases.databaseLimitReachedDescription: You have reached the maximum number of databases for this server (limit: {limit}). Please delete some databases to create a new one.
serverDatabases.sensitiveInfoDescription: This dialog contains sensitive database credentials including passwords. Please ensure you are in a secure environment before proceeding.
serverDatabases.rememberChoice: Remember my choice and do not show this warning again
serverDatabases.rememberedChoiceCleared: Remembered choice has been cleared. You will see the warning again.
serverDatabases.noDatabasesDescription: Create your first database to start storing and managing your data
serverDatabases.noDatabasesNoLimit: This server does not have database access enabled
serverDatabases.confirmDeleteDescription: Are you sure you want to delete the database "{database}"? This action cannot be undone and will remove all data.
serverDatabases.noDatabaseHostsDescription: No database hosts are configured. Please contact an administrator to set up database hosts.

serverBackups.title: Backups
serverBackups.noBackupPermission: You do not have permission to manage server backups.
serverBackups.backupLimitReachedDescription: You have reached the maximum number of backups for this server (limit: {limit}). Please delete some backups to create a new one.
serverBackups.createBackupDescription: Create a new backup of your server data.
serverBackups.name: Backup Name
serverBackups.ignoreFilesPlaceholder: Enter file patterns to ignore (one per line)
serverBackups.ignoreFilesHelp: Specify files or directories to exclude from the backup. Use patterns like "*.log" or "temp/*".
serverBackups.restoreBackupDescription: Restore your server from this backup. This will overwrite existing files.
serverBackups.truncateDirectoryHelp: If enabled, the server directory will be completely cleared before restoration. Use with caution.
serverBackups.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this backup? This action cannot be undone.
serverBackups.noBackups: Oh... It looks like there are no backups here
serverBackups.noBackupsDescription: Create your first backup to protect your server data
serverBackups.noBackupsNoLimit: This server does not have backup access enabled
serverBackups.lockConfirm: Are you sure you want to lock this backup? Locked backups cannot be deleted or restored.
serverBackups.unlockConfirm: Are you sure you want to unlock this backup? This will allow deletion and restoration.
serverBackups.restoreLockedError: Backup is currently locked. Please unlock it first before restoring.

serverImport.title: Server Import
serverImport.description: Import server files from remote SFTP or FTP servers. The server must be offline for imports to work.
serverImport.featureDisabledDescription: Server import has been disabled by the administrator. Please contact support if you need to import files from remote servers.
serverImport.infoDescription: Import files from a remote SFTP or FTP server to your server. The server must be stopped before importing. Large imports may take a significant amount of time.
serverImport.noImportsDescription: Get started by importing files from a remote SFTP or FTP server. The server will be automatically stopped during the import process.
serverImport.drawerDescription: Configure the import settings to transfer files from a remote server.
serverImport.credentialsHelp: SSH/SFTP credentials for the remote server.
serverImport.pathsHelp: Configure where the files are coming from and where they should go.
serverImport.wipeHelp: If enabled, clears the destination directory before importing. Use with caution!
serverImport.wipeAllFiles: Wipe All Server Files Before Import
serverImport.wipeAllFilesHelp: If enabled, deletes ALL files and folders in the server root directory before importing. This ensures a completely clean import.
serverImport.wipeAllFilesWarning: ⚠️ This will permanently delete ALL existing server files before importing!

validation.sourceLocationInvalid: Source location must be an absolute path (starting with /)

serverFirewall.title: Firewall
serverFirewall.description: Manage incoming connections to your server.
serverFirewall.rulesInfoDescription: Control traffic to your server by creating allow or block rules based on IP addresses.
serverFirewall.featureDisabledDescription: Firewall management has been disabled by the administrator.
serverFirewall.noRulesDescription: Get started by creating your first firewall rule to secure your server.
serverFirewall.allocationHelp: Select the allocation (port) this rule applies to.
serverFirewall.confirmDeleteDescription: Are you sure you want to delete this firewall rule? This action cannot be undone.

serverProxy.title: Reverse Proxy
serverProxy.description: Configure domains to point to your server ports.
serverProxy.infoDescription: Proxies allow you to use a custom domain (e.g., play.example.com) to connect to your server without needing to specify a port. SSL certificates can be automatically generated securely.
serverProxy.noProxiesDescription: Create your first reverse proxy to connect valid domains to your server ports.
serverProxy.createModalDescription: Configure a new reverse proxy domain.
serverProxy.domainDescription: The domain name you want to use for this proxy.
serverProxy.deleteModalDescription: Are you sure you want to delete the proxy for {domain}?
serverProxy.featureDisabledDescription: The reverse proxy feature has been disabled by the administrator.
serverProxy.tipDns: DNS propagation may take a few minutes if you just updated your records.
serverProxy.tipPorts: Port 80 and 443 are reserved. Proxies map these standard ports to your internal server port.
serverProxy.tipSsl: SSL certificates are auto-renewed if you use Let's Encrypt. Verify your email is correct.

serverSubdomains.title: Subdomains
serverSubdomains.description: Manage subdomains assigned to your server.
serverSubdomains.limitReachedDescription: You have reached the maximum of {limit} subdomains for this server.
serverSubdomains.noSubdomainsDescription: Create a subdomain to easily access your server.
serverSubdomains.deleteDescription: Are you sure you want to delete {subdomain}? This action cannot be undone.
serverSubdomains.newSubdomainDescription: Create a new subdomain for your server.
serverSubdomains.subdomainHint: Enter the subdomain prefix (e.g. 'play' for play.example.com).

serverSchedules.title: Schedules
serverSchedules.description: Manage automated tasks for your server.
serverSchedules.noSchedulesDescription: Create your first schedule to automate server tasks.
serverSchedules.createScheduleDescription: Create a new automated task schedule.
serverSchedules.name: Schedule Name
serverSchedules.nameHelp: A descriptive name for this schedule.
serverSchedules.cronHelp: Define when this schedule should run using cron syntax.
serverSchedules.onlyWhenOnlineHelp: Should this schedule only run when the server is online?
serverSchedules.confirmDeleteDescription: Are you sure you want to delete '{scheduleName}'? This action cannot be undone.
serverSchedules.noSchedulePermission: You do not have permission to view schedules.
serverSchedules.featureDisabledDescription: The schedules feature has been disabled by the administrator. Please contact support if you need to automate server tasks.

serverTasks.title: Schedule Tasks
serverTasks.createTaskDescription: Add a new task to this schedule.
serverTasks.noTasksDescription: Create your first task for this schedule.
serverTasks.actionHelp: The type of action this task will perform.
serverTasks.selectPowerActionHelp: Choose the power action to perform.
serverTasks.backupIgnoredFilesHelp: Files or directories to ignore during backup (comma-separated).
serverTasks.commandHelp: The command to execute on the server.
serverTasks.timeOffsetHelp: Delay in seconds before executing this task.
serverTasks.continueOnFailureHelp: Should the schedule continue if this task fails?
serverTasks.sequenceIdHelp: The order in which this task runs (1 = first).
serverTasks.confirmDeleteDescription: Are you sure you want to delete the {action} task ({payload})? This action cannot be undone.
serverTasks.noSchedulePermission: You do not have permission to view schedule tasks.

serverSubusers.title: Subusers
serverSubusers.description: Manage subusers and their permissions for this server
serverSubusers.managePermissionsDescription: Select the specific permissions this subuser should have access to. Choose individual permissions or select all to grant full access.
serverSubusers.addSubuserDialogDescription: Enter the email address of the user you want to add
serverSubusers.noSubusersDescription: No subusers have been added to this server yet. Add one to get started.
serverSubusers.noResultsDescription: No subusers match your search criteria.
serverSubusers.confirmDeleteDescription: Are you sure you want to remove {email} from this server? This action cannot be undone.
serverSubusers.noSubuserManagementPermission: Only the server owner can manage subusers.
serverSubusers.featureDisabledDescription: Subuser management has been disabled by the administrator. Please contact the server owner if you need to manage access.

activity.name: Activity
activity.description: Permissions that control a user's ability to view server activity.

read.name: Read
read.description: Allows a user to view server activity.

subdomain.name: Subdomain
subdomain.description: Permissions that control a user's ability to manage subdomains for this server.

create.name: Create
create.description: Allows a user to create new subdomains for this server.

read.name: Read
read.description: Allows a user to view subdomains for this server.

update.name: Update
update.description: Allows a user to update subdomains for this server.

delete.name: Delete
delete.description: Allows a user to delete subdomains for this server.

manage.name: Manage
manage.description: Allows a user to create, update, delete, and sync subdomains for this server.

websocket.name: WebSocket
websocket.description: Allows a user to connect to the server console via WebSocket.

connect.name: Connect
connect.description: Allows a user to connect to the server console via WebSocket.

control.name: Control
control.description: Permissions that control a user's ability to control the power state of a server, or send commands.

console.name: Console
console.description: Allows a user to send commands to the server instance via the console.

start.name: Start
start.description: Allows a user to start the server if it is stopped.

stop.name: Stop
stop.description: Allows a user to stop a server if it is running.

restart.name: Restart
restart.description: Allows a user to perform a server restart. This allows them to start the server if it is offline, but not put the server in a completely stopped state.

user.name: User
user.description: Permissions that allow a user to manage other subusers on a server. They will never be able to edit their own account, or assign permissions they do not have themselves.

create.name: Create
create.description: Allows a user to create new subusers for the server.

read.name: Read
read.description: Allows the user to view subusers and their permissions for the server.

update.name: Update
update.description: Allows a user to modify other subusers.

delete.name: Delete
delete.description: Allows a user to delete a subuser from the server.

file.name: File
file.description: Permissions that control a user's ability to modify the filesystem for this server.

create.name: Create
create.description: Allows a user to create additional files and folders via the Panel or direct upload.

read.name: Read
read.description: Allows a user to view the contents of a directory, but not view the contents of or download files.

readContent.name: Read Content
readContent.description: Allows a user to view the contents of a given file. This will also allow the user to download files.

update.name: Update
update.description: Allows a user to update the contents of an existing file or directory.

delete.name: Delete
delete.description: Allows a user to delete files or directories.

archive.name: Archive
archive.description: Allows a user to archive the contents of a directory as well as decompress existing archives on the system.

sftp.name: SFTP
sftp.description: Allows a user to connect to SFTP and manage server files using the other assigned file permissions.

backup.name: Backup
backup.description: Permissions that control a user's ability to generate and manage server backups.

create.name: Create
create.description: Allows a user to create new backups for this server.

read.name: Read
read.description: Allows a user to view all backups that exist for this server.

delete.name: Delete
delete.description: Allows a user to remove backups from the system.

download.name: Download
download.description: Allows a user to download a backup for the server. Danger: this allows a user to access all files for the server in the backup.

restore.name: Restore
restore.description: Allows a user to restore a backup for the server. Danger: this allows the user to delete all of the server files in the process.

allocation.name: Allocation
allocation.description: Permissions that control a user's ability to modify the port allocations for this server.

read.name: Read
read.description: Allows a user to view all allocations currently assigned to this server. Users with any level of access to this server can always view the primary allocation.

create.name: Create
create.description: Allows a user to assign additional allocations to the server.

update.name: Update
update.description: Allows a user to change the primary server allocation and attach notes to each allocation.

delete.name: Delete
delete.description: Allows a user to delete an allocation from the server.

startup.name: Startup
startup.description: Permissions that control a user's ability to view this server's startup parameters.

read.name: Read
read.description: Allows a user to view the startup parameters for a server.

update.name: Update
update.description: Allows a user to modify startup parameters for a server.

docker_image.name: Update Docker Image
docker_image.description: Allows a user to modify the Docker image used for a server.

database.name: Database
database.description: Permissions that control a user's ability to create and manage server databases.

create.name: Create
create.description: Allows a user to create new databases for this server.

read.name: Read
read.description: Allows a user to view all databases that exist for this server.

update.name: Update
update.description: Allows a user to view passwords for databases.

delete.name: Delete
delete.description: Allows a user to remove databases from the system.

schedule.name: Schedule
schedule.description: Permissions that control a user's ability to manage automated tasks for this server.

create.name: Create
create.description: Allows a user to create new schedules for this server.

read.name: Read
read.description: Allows a user to view all schedules that exist for this server.

update.name: Update
update.description: Allows a user to modify schedules for a server.

delete.name: Delete
delete.description: Allows a user to remove schedules from the system.

settings.name: Settings
settings.description: Permissions that control a user's ability to view and modify server settings.

rename.name: Rename
rename.description: Allows a user to rename a server.

reinstall.name: Reinstall
reinstall.description: Allows a user to trigger a server reinstallation.

firewall.name: Firewall
firewall.description: Permissions that control a user's ability to manage firewall rules for this server.

read.name: Read
read.description: Allows a user to view the firewall rules for this server.

manage.name: Manage
manage.description: Allows a user to create, update, and delete firewall rules for this server.

proxy.name: Proxy
proxy.description: Permissions that control a user's ability to manage proxy rules for this server.

read.name: Read
read.description: Allows a user to view the proxy rules for this server.

manage.name: Manage
manage.description: Allows a user to create, update, and delete proxy rules for this server.

import.name: Import
import.description: Permissions that control a user's ability to manage server imports.

read.name: Read
read.description: Allows a user to view server imports.

manage.name: Manage
manage.description: Allows a user to create and manage server imports.

templates.name: Templates
templates.description: Permissions that control a user's ability to manage and install server templates.

read.name: Read
read.description: Allows a user to view available server templates.

install.name: Install
install.description: Allows a user to install templates on the server.

serverStartup.transferDescription: Transfer your server to another software environment.
serverStartup.title: Server Startup
serverStartup.description: Control your server's startup command, Docker image, and environment variables.
serverStartup.startupHelp: Edit the command that will be used to start the server.
serverStartup.variablesHelp: Configure environmental variables for your server.
serverStartup.valueDoesNotMatchFormat: Value does not match the required format.
serverStartup.noVariablesConfigured: No environment variables configured for this software.
serverStartup.noStartupPermission: You do not have permission to manage startup settings or it has been disabled by an administrator.
serverStartup.spellSelectionHelp: Change your server software and configuration.
serverStartup.discoverRealmsHelp: Discover available software environments for this category.
serverStartup.doubleCheckConfiguration: Double check your configuration before applying

serverSettings.title: Server Settings
serverSettings.description: Manage your server configuration, SFTP details, and perform administrative actions.
serverSettings.serverInformationDescription: Update the identifying details for this server.
serverSettings.sftpDetailsDescription: Details for connecting to your server via SFTP.
serverSettings.sftpInfoDescription: Use an SFTP client like FileZilla or WinSCP. Enter the host, port, your username, and your account password.
serverSettings.reinstallWarning: This will reinstall the server. Your files may be overwritten depending on your choice.
serverSettings.reinstallConfirmation: Are you sure you want to reinstall this server?
serverSettings.deleteServerDescription: Permanently delete this server and all associated data.
serverSettings.deleteServerStep1Description: Deleting this server will remove all data, files, and configurations locally and remotely. This cannot be undone.
serverSettings.deleteServerStep2Description: Please acknowledge that this action is irreversible.
serverSettings.deleteServerStep2Confirm: I understand this action is irreversible
serverSettings.deleteServerStep3Description: Please solve this simple math problem to verify you are human.
serverSettings.deleteServerStep4Description: To confirm, please type the name of the server.

messages.drop_description: Release your files to start uploading to

editor.title: Editing: {file}
editor.loading_description: Please wait while the file content is loaded

create_folder.title: Create New Folder
create_folder.description: Enter a name for the new folder. It will be created in {root}

delete.title: Delete Files
delete.description: Are you sure you want to delete {count} item(s)? This action cannot be undone.

move_copy.move_description: Move {count} item(s) to a new location.
move_copy.copy_description: Copy {count} item(s) to a new location.

compress.title: Compress Files
compress.description: Choose a format and name for your archive.
compress.name_help: Defaults to current timestamp if left empty.

pull.title: Pull File
pull.description: Download a file directly to your server from a URL.

wipe.title: Wipe All Files
wipe.description: This action is irreversible and extremely dangerous.
wipe.confirmation: Are you absolutely sure you want to delete every single file and folder on this server? This cannot be undone and will likely break any running processes.

ignored.title: Ignored Content
ignored.description: Hide specific files or folders from the view.
ignored.info: Patterns are case-sensitive. These filters only affect your local view and do not delete any files on the server.

permissions.title: Update Permissions
permissions.info: Be careful when changing permissions. Incorrect settings can make files inaccessible or insecure.

preview.error: Failed to load image preview. Please try downloading it instead.

roles.title: Roles & Permissions
roles.subtitle: Manage roles and their associated permissions.
roles.create_description: Create a new role to assign permissions to users.
roles.edit_description: Modify the role details and permissions.
roles.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this role?

permissions.title: Manage Permissions
permissions.description: Add or remove permissions for this role.

managing.title: Managing Roles
managing.description: Roles allow you to group permissions together and assign them to users. Use descriptive names and distinct colors to keep your administrative structure organized.

permissions.title: Granular Permissions
permissions.description: Each role can have an unlimited number of permission nodes. This allows for precise control over what each user group can see and do within the panel.

security.title: Security First
security.item1: Always follow the principle of least privilege.
security.item2: Avoid giving 'admin' permissions to untrusted roles.
security.item3: Regularly audit role assignments and permissions.

locations.title: Locations
locations.subtitle: Manage all locations in your system.
locations.create_description: Create your first location to get started

form.create_description: Fill in the details to create a new location.
form.name: Name

what.title: What are Locations?
what.description: Locations group nodes by geography or purpose. Keep your infrastructure organized and easy to navigate across regions and data centers.

examples.title: Examples
examples.usa_desc: nodes where Wings runs for US servers
examples.naming: Use specific names like USA-East, USA-West, or Romania-Bucharest for clarity.

getting_started.title: Getting Started
getting_started.step1: Click Create Location above to add your first location.
getting_started.step2: After creating, a Nodes button appears next to row actions.
getting_started.step3: Click Nodes to add and manage nodes for that location.

node.title: Nodes
node.description: View and manage all nodes in the system
node.search_placeholder: Search by name, fqdn, or description...

form.create_description: Fill in the details to create a new node.
form.name: Name
form.visibility_help: By setting a node to private you will be denying the ability to auto-deploy to this node.
form.fqdn_help: Please enter domain name (e.g. node.example.com) to be used for connecting to the daemon. An IP address may be used only if you are not using SSL for this node.
form.ssl_warning: Your Panel is currently configured to use a secure connection. In order for browsers to connect to your node it must use a SSL connection.
form.proxy_help: If you are running the daemon behind a proxy such as Cloudflare, select this to have the daemon skip looking for certificates on boot.
form.daemon_base_help: Enter the directory where server files should be stored. If you use OVH you should check your partition scheme. You may need to use /home/daemon-data to have enough space.
form.maintenance_help: When enabled, this node will not accept new server deployments.
form.upload_size_help: Maximum file upload size for this node.
form.select_location_description: Select a location for this node. Total locations: {total}
form.description_placeholder: A brief description of this node...

wings.config_help: This configuration file should be saved as /etc/featherpanel/config.yml on your Wings daemon.
wings.reset_key_success: Master daemon reset key requested successfully

what.title: What are Nodes?
what.description: Nodes are machines that run Wings, hosting and managing your containers for deployments.

locations.title: Nodes and Locations
locations.description: Each node belongs to a location so you can separate infrastructure by region or purpose and deploy predictably.

wings.title: About Wings (the daemon)
wings.p1: Wings is the daemon FeatherPanel uses to communicate with your Docker host. It knows how to schedule, deploy, and manage containers securely and reliably, so your servers start, stop, and scale where and how you expect.
wings.p2: By pairing locations and nodes with Wings, you get a clean separation of regions and infrastructure, plus predictable deployments with health checks, resource limits, and streamlined container management.

allocations.title: Allocations
allocations.confirm_bulk_delete_description: Are you sure you want to delete {count} allocation(s)? Allocations that are assigned to servers will be skipped. This action cannot be undone.
allocations.confirm_delete_unused_description: Delete unused allocations that are not assigned to any server. Optionally filter by IP address (subnet) to delete only allocations from a specific IP. This action cannot be undone.
allocations.delete_unused_ip_help: Leave empty to delete all unused allocations, or enter a specific IP to delete only allocations from that subnet/IP.

help.what_are_allocations_text: Allocations are IP:Port pairs a node uses to host servers. Each server needs an allocation to run and accept traffic.
help.recommendation: Recommendation: pre-create generous ranges (e.g., 25565-25900) to avoid running out during peak times.
help.protocols_and_firewall_text: Allocations are TCP/UDP by default. If you’re using a firewall other than iptables, ensure these ports are allowed on both protocols. For reverse proxies or DDoS protection layers, open/forward the same ranges there too.

create.title: Create Allocation
create.description: Fill in the details to create a new allocation.
create.port_range_help: Enter a single port (e.g., 25565) or a range (e.g., 25565-25700) to create multiple allocations at once.

allocations.no_results: No allocations found matching your search.

config.title: Remote Wings Config
config.description: View and edit the Wings configuration file.
config.info_description: This is the primary configuration file for Wings. Be careful when making changes as they can affect the stability of your node.
config.restart_help: If enabled, Wings will be restarted to apply the new configuration immediately.
config.restart_notice: Wings is being restarted to apply the new configuration.

diagnostics.title: Diagnostics
diagnostics.description: Generate a diagnostic report for this node to help with troubleshooting.
diagnostics.custom_url_help: Override the default paste service URL for this report.
diagnostics.generate_failed: Failed to generate diagnostic report. Please check the logs.
diagnostics.include_endpoints_help: Include internal API endpoints in the report.
diagnostics.include_logs_help: Include recent logs from the Wings daemon.
diagnostics.log_lines_help: Number of log lines to include.
diagnostics.raw_text_help: Output the report as plain text instead of JSON.
diagnostics.upload_url_help: Optional URL to upload the report to (e.g., bin.featherpanel.com).

docker.title: Docker Management
docker.cache_size_help: Total size of Docker build cache.
docker.containers_size_help: Total size of all Docker containers on this node.
docker.images_active_help: Number of Docker images currently in use by servers.
docker.images_size_help: Total size of all Docker images on this node.
docker.images_total_help: Total number of Docker images on this node.
docker.info_description: General information about the Docker engine running on this node.
docker.prune_confirm: Are you sure you want to prune Docker? This will remove all unused images, containers, and networks. This action cannot be undone.

modules.title: Wings Modules
modules.description: Manage extension modules for the Wings daemon.
modules.configure_description: Modify the configuration for this module. Be careful, incorrect settings may cause the module to fail.
modules.configure_disabled_notice: You must disable this module before you can change its configuration.
modules.no_modules_description: This node doesn't have any Wings modules installed.

network.title: Network Information
network.description: Network interfaces and IP addresses assigned to this node.
network.help: This information is retrieved directly from the node's network stack.
network.no_ips: No IP addresses found on this node.

overview.title: Node Overview
overview.description: General status and resource overview for this node.
overview.name: Name

self_update.title: Wings Self-Update
self_update.confirm: Are you sure you want to trigger a self-update? This will restart the Wings daemon.
self_update.success: Self-update request accepted. Wings will handle the update in the background.
self_update.safe_description: Updates are automatically verified for integrity before installation.
self_update.auto_description: Active servers will not be interrupted during the update process.
self_update.options_description: Configure advanced parameters for the update process.
self_update.source_url_help: Download from a custom HTTP/HTTPS URL.
self_update.version_help: Leave empty to fetch the latest release.
self_update.force_help: Reinstall even if already on the requested version.

system.title: System Information
system.update_help: A new version of Wings is available.

terminal.title: Wings Terminal
terminal.description: Direct shell access to the host node.
terminal.warning_description: Commands are executed directly on the host system as the daemon user. Use extreme caution.

servers.title: Servers
servers.description: Manage all servers in your system.
servers.search_placeholder: Search by name, description, or status...

managing.title: Managing Servers
managing.description: View, create, edit, and delete servers. Use search and pagination to quickly navigate large fleets.

relationships.title: Relationships
relationships.description: Each server belongs to an Owner (user), runs on a Node (machine), and is grouped by Realm & Spell (template/runtime).

resources.title: Resources & Limits
resources.description: Resource usage (RAM/CPU/Disk) and limits (allocations, databases, backups) are summarized per server.

tips.title: Tips
tips.item1: Keep descriptions meaningful to identify purpose at a glance.
tips.item2: Review suspended/unknown statuses regularly to clean up stale hosts.
tips.item3: Align Realm/Spell choices with the intended workload/runtime.

messages.hard_delete_warning_p1: Hard deleting a server should only be used if:
messages.hard_delete_item1: You have lost connection to Wings (the node daemon)
messages.hard_delete_item2: The node this server is on is permanently dead/offline
messages.hard_delete_item3: You need to remove the server from the database without contacting Wings
messages.hard_delete_caution: Hard delete will ONLY remove the server from the database. It will NOT delete the server files, containers, or any data from Wings!
messages.hard_delete_p2: If the node is still operational, use the regular 'Confirm Delete' option instead.

transfer.title: Transfer Server
transfer.description: Transfer this server to a different node and choose the new primary allocation.
transfer.warning_text: Server transfers are NOT RECOMMENDED. This feature exists but is known to be unreliable. Things CAN and WILL go wrong.
transfer.beta_item1: Transfers can be cancelled but partial data may remain.
transfer.beta_item2: The server will be stopped during transfer.
transfer.beta_item7: Always create and verify backups EXTERNALLY before transferring.
transfer.beta_item8: Network issues can cause partial transfers or data corruption.

form.create_subtitle: Add a new server to the panel.
form.name: Server Name
form.description_help: A brief description of this server. (Optional)
form.startup_help: The command that will be used to start the server. The following data substitutes are available: {{SERVER_MEMORY}}, {{SERVER_IP}}, {{SERVER_PORT}}, and spell variables.
form.owner_help: Email address of the Server Owner.
form.select_owner_description: Select a user to assign as the server owner. Total users: {total}
form.search_users: Search users by username or email...
form.skip_scripts_help: Whether to skip startup scripts during server initialization.
form.location_help: The location where this server will be deployed.
form.node_help: The node which this server will be deployed to.
form.allocation_help: The main allocation that will be assigned to this server.
form.select_realm_description: Select a realm for this server. Total realms: {total}
form.select_spell_description: Select a spell for this server. Total spells: {total}
form.docker_image_help: Select the Docker image for this spell. This will be used to deploy the server.
form.memory_help: The maximum amount of memory allowed for this container. Setting this to 0 will allow unlimited memory usage.
form.swap_help: Setting this to 0 will disable swap space on this server. Setting to -1 will allow unlimited swap.
form.disk_help: The maximum amount of disk space allowed for this container. Setting this to 0 will allow unlimited disk usage.
form.cpu_help: The maximum amount of CPU allowed for this container. Setting this to 0 will allow unlimited CPU usage.
form.io_help: Advanced: The IO performance of this server relative to other running containers. A value between 10 and 1000.
form.oom_killer_help: Terminates the server if it breaches the memory limits. Enabling OOM killer may cause server processes to exit unexpectedly.
form.threads_help: Advanced: Enter the specific CPU threads that this process can run on, or leave blank to allow all threads. This can be a single number, or a comma separated list. Example: 0, 0-1,3, or 0,1,3,4.
form.database_limit_help: The total number of databases a user is allowed to create for this server.
form.allocation_limit_help: The total number of allocations a user is allowed to create for this server.
form.backup_limit_help: The total number of backups that can be created for this server.
form.startup_command_help: The command that will be used to start the server. Populated from selected spell. The following data substitutes are available: {{SERVER_MEMORY}}, {{SERVER_IP}}, {{SERVER_PORT}}, and spell variables.

wizard.step1_subtitle: Set the server owner and basic information
wizard.step2_subtitle: Choose where the server will be deployed
wizard.step3_subtitle: Configure the realm, spell, and Docker image
wizard.step4_subtitle: Define memory, CPU, disk, and other resource constraints
wizard.step5_subtitle: Set limits for databases, allocations, and backups
wizard.step6_subtitle: Review your configuration and create the server
wizard.validation_error: Please complete all required fields before proceeding

details.title: Core Details
details.external_id_help: External identifier for this server from an external system
details.skip_zerotrust_help: Skip zero trust checks during server operations
details.location_node_help: Use the Server Transfer feature to change node or location

resources.title: Resource Limits
resources.description: Configure memory, CPU, disk, and other resource constraints

application.title: Application Configuration
application.description: Configure realm, spell, and Docker image settings
application.variables_description: Configure environment variables for this spell

limits.title: Feature Limits
limits.description: Set limits for databases, allocations, and backups

startup.title: Startup Configuration
startup.description: Configure the startup command for this server

allocations.title: Network Allocations
allocations.description: Manage network allocations (IP:Port) for this server

actions.suspension_description: Control whether users can access this server
actions.delete_description: Permanently delete this server and all associated data
actions.delete_confirm_description: This will permanently delete {name} and all associated files, databases, and backups. This action cannot be undone.

tickets.title: Support Tickets
tickets.viewAndManage: View and manage all support tickets in the system

messages.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this ticket?

managing.title: Managing Tickets
managing.description: Keep track of all your support requests in one place. You can filter by status and category to quickly find what you're looking for.

categories.title: Categorization
categories.description: Organize support requests by assigning them to categories. This helps in routing tickets to the right team members.

support.title: Priority Support
support.description: Higher priority tickets are highlighted to ensure they get the attention they deserve from your staff.

categories.title: Ticket Categories
categories.description: Create and manage ticket categories to organize support requests.
categories.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this category?

managing.title: Managing Categories
managing.description: Create and edit categories to organize your support system. Each category can have its own support email and hours.

emails.title: Support Emails
emails.description: Each category can be linked to a specific support email. This helps in tracking communication for different topics.

icons.title: Visual Identity
icons.description: Upload custom icons for your categories to make them easily distinguishable in the dashboard.

priorities.title: Ticket Priorities
priorities.subtitle: Manage ticket priorities to define urgency levels

levels.title: Priority Levels
levels.description: Define different priority levels like Low, Medium, High, and Urgent to manage response expectations.

visuals.title: Visual Cues
visuals.description: Assign distinct colors to priorities to help staff quickly identify high-priority requests in the list.

urgent.title: Urgent Requests
urgent.description: Urgent priorities should be used sparingly for critical issues requiring immediate intervention.

statuses.title: Ticket Statuses
statuses.subtitle: Manage ticket statuses to track progress

workflow.title: State Management
workflow.description: Statuses define the lifecycle of a ticket. Typical workflows include Open, In Progress, Resolved, and Closed.

tracking.title: Progress Tracking
tracking.description: Clear status labels help both users and staff understand the current progress of any support request.

states.title: Custom States
states.description: You can create custom statuses like 'Awaiting User' or 'Pending Third Party' for more granular tracking.

view.edit_description: Update ticket metadata and basic information

dashboard.title: Admin Terminal
dashboard.subtitle: System Core & Infrastructure
dashboard.cache_cleared: System cache has been cleared successfully.

app_url_warning.title: APP_URL Mismatch Detected
app_url_warning.message: Your panel is currently using the default featherpanel.mythical.systems URL. This will cause security issues and breaks authentication.

welcome.subtitle: Management interface active • All systems operational

version.title: System Version
version.up_to_date: Your system is up to date and secured.
version.integrity_coming_soon: This feature is coming soon in a future update.

analytics.title: Analytics Dashboard
analytics.subtitle: Overview of system performance and usage statistics

activity.title: Activity Analytics

activity.hourly_desc: Activity patterns by hour of day (last 7 days)

infrastructure.title: Infrastructure Analytics

servers.subtitle: Deep insights into server statistics, resource usage, and patterns

users.title: User Analytics
users.subtitle: Comprehensive insights into user behavior and statistics
users.reg_trend_desc: Daily user registrations over the last 30 days
users.role_dist_desc: Breakdown of users across different roles

nav.users_desc: Comprehensive user statistics including registrations, roles, security, and growth metrics
nav.activity_desc: Track user activities, trends, peak hours, and activity type distribution across your panel
nav.infrastructure_desc: Locations, nodes, allocations, and database host distribution and resource usage
nav.servers_desc: Server statistics, database usage per server, allocation patterns, and resource distribution
nav.content_desc: Realms, eggs, nests, redirect links, mail templates, and content management insights
nav.system_desc: Mail queue monitoring, email delivery statistics, and queue performance metrics

nodes.title: Node Status Dashboard
nodes.subtitle: Real-time monitoring of all infrastructure nodes
nodes.no_nodes_description: No nodes found please make sure to setup a location and a node!

marketplace.title: FeatherCloud Marketplace
marketplace.subtitle: Browse and install extensions, spells, and translations to enhance your FeatherPanel experience

plugins.title: Plugins
plugins.description: Addons that extend FeatherPanel with new features and functionality

spells.title: Spells
spells.description: Server templates to run specific games and applications on FeatherPanel

translations.title: Translations
translations.description: Translations for the panel provided by the community and official contributors
translations.community_description: Community translations will appear here when available. You can manage your local translations from the translations page.
translations.download_coming_soon: Download functionality will be available when the API is ready
translations.install_coming_soon: Install functionality will be available when the API is ready

about.title: About the Marketplace
about.description: The FeatherCloud Marketplace provides access to community-created and official extensions for FeatherPanel. Browse verified plugins, install spells for your servers, and discover new ways to customize your panel experience.

plugins.title: Plugins
plugins.subtitle: Browse and install plugins from the online repository

cloud_missing.title: Cloud Account Missing
cloud_missing.description: FeatherCloud credentials are not configured. You cannot download premium plugins until you configure your cloud account credentials in Cloud Management.

spells.title: Spells Marketplace
spells.subtitle: Browse and install spells from the online repository
spells.select_realm_error: Please select a realm before installing

online_banner.title: Have some spells to share?
online_banner.description: Publish your creations to the community. Download your spell and head over to our cloud platform. Our team aims to review and publish within 48 hours.
online_banner.tip: Tip: Include description, tags, and a banner for better visibility.

grid.unverified_warning: Unverified spell - review source before installing

dialog.title: Install Spell
dialog.realm_help: Select the realm where this spell will be installed.
dialog.unverified_desc: This spell is not verified. Installing unverified spells can be unsafe. Please review the source code before installing.
dialog.already_installed_desc: You already have this spell installed. Installing it again will create another instance.

help.repo_desc: Browse community-created spells from our online repository. Install directly from this page with a single click.
help.install_desc: Select a realm and install spells with one click. Verified spells are marked with a checkmark for your safety.
help.security_desc: Installing third-party spells can be risky. FeatherPanel and its team are not liable for what you install.

cloud_management.title: FeatherCloud Cloud Management
cloud_management.subtitle: Connect your FeatherPanel instance to FeatherCloud using secure credentials

connection_status.connected_desc: Your panel is successfully linked. You can access premium plugins, FeatherAI, and cloud intelligence services.
connection_status.not_connected_desc: Link your panel with FeatherCloud to access premium features and cloud services.

credentials.title: Credential Information
credentials.description: Last rotation timestamps for your cloud credentials

feather_ai.title: FeatherAI
feather_ai.description: Access FeatherPanel's built-in AI model for intelligent automation and analysis without requiring external API keys.

premium_plugins.title: Premium Plugins
premium_plugins.description: Download and install paid plugins directly from the FeatherCloud marketplace with seamless integration.

cloud_intelligence.title: Cloud Intelligence Database
cloud_intelligence.description: Protect your host from abuse with real-time threat intelligence from across the FeatherCloud network.

identification.title: Instance Identification
identification.description: Your credentials uniquely identify your FeatherPanel instance to its owner.

privacy.title: Security & Privacy
privacy.description: All credentials are encrypted and scoped to your environment.

permissions.title: Permission-Based Access
permissions.description: Keys inherit administrator permissions for granular control.

audit.title: Full Audit Trail
audit.description: Every cloud service interaction is logged for complete traceability.

oauth2.title: OAuth2 Integration
oauth2.description: Securely link your panel with FeatherCloud using OAuth2 authentication
oauth2.step1: You'll be redirected to FeatherCloud's OAuth2 authorization page
oauth2.step2: Your panel information (name, logo, URL) will be securely shared
oauth2.step3: FeatherCloud will generate and store the necessary credentials
oauth2.step4: You'll be redirected back to your panel once the connection is established

rotate_dialog.title: Confirm Key Rotation
rotate_dialog.description: Are you sure you want to rotate your FeatherCloud credentials? This action will generate new keys for your panel.
rotate_dialog.warning1: New keys will be generated immediately
rotate_dialog.warning2: You must update your FeatherCloud account with the new keys
rotate_dialog.warning3: Old keys will no longer work after rotation
rotate_dialog.warning4: Cloud credentials are currently empty - premium plugins cannot be downloaded until FeatherCloud credentials are configured

finish.processing_desc: Please wait while we save your cloud credentials...
finish.success_desc: Your panel is now linked with FeatherCloud. You can now access premium plugins, FeatherAI, and cloud intelligence services.
finish.next_step1: Access premium plugins from the FeatherCloud marketplace
finish.next_step2: Use FeatherAI for intelligent automation and analysis
finish.next_step3: Benefit from cloud intelligence database for abuse prevention
finish.error_desc: Please try linking again from the Cloud Management page.

users.title: Users
users.subtitle: Manage all users in your system
users.search_placeholder: Search by username, email, or role...

create.title: Create User
create.description: Fill in the details to create a new user
create.validation: Please fill in all required fields

tips.username: Choose a unique username that's easy to remember
tips.role: Assign the appropriate role based on user responsibilities
tips.email: User will receive login credentials via email

help.security_desc: Ensure strong passwords and assign minimal required permissions. Users can enable 2FA after first login.

managing.title: Managing Users
managing.description: View, create, and edit accounts. Use the search to quickly find users by username, email, or role. Pagination and column visibility are customizable.

roles.title: Roles & Permissions
roles.description: Assign roles to control access and capabilities. Role badges reflect the assigned role, and colors help you spot important roles at a glance.

security.title: Security Actions
security.item1: Ban or unban accounts when needed
security.item3: Audit activities, servers, and mails per user

form.title: User Details
form.external_id_help: External ID for integration. Leave empty or set to 0 to clear.
form.password_placeholder: Leave blank to keep current password
form.password_help: Leave completely blank to keep the current password.

messages.discord_confirm: Are you sure you want to unlink Discord from this user?
messages.ban_confirm: Are you sure you want to ban/unban this user?
messages.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete user {username}?

form.title: Title
form.create_description: Create a new notification to display to users.

messages.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this notification?

alerts.title: System Alerts
alerts.description: Notifications are a powerful way to communicate with all users. Use them for maintenance announcements, policy updates, or important system news.

markdown.title: Rich Content
markdown.description: Messages support full Markdown syntax. You can use bold text, lists, and even code blocks to make your announcements clear and engaging.

delivery.title: sticky & Dismissible
delivery.item1: Sticky notifications remain at the top of the dashboard.
delivery.item2: Dismissible alerts can be hidden by users once read.
delivery.item3: Use non-dismissible for critical legal or system notices.

categories.title: Knowledgebase Categories
categories.subtitle: Manage all knowledgebase categories in your system.

form.name: Name
form.create_description: Fill in the details to create a new knowledgebase category.

messages.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete article {title}?

attachments.title: Attachments
attachments.description: Upload any file for this article (max 50MB)

tags.title: Tags
tags.add_dialog_description: Enter tag names separated by commas (e.g., tutorial, guide, faq)

managing.title: Knowledge Management
managing.description: Organize your documentation into categories. Each category can have many articles to help your users find what they need.

content.title: Rich Content
content.description: Articles support Markdown, allowing you to use formatting, images, and code blocks for clear and helpful guides.

attachments.title: Assets & Tags
attachments.description: Upload relevant files as attachments and use tags to make your articles more searchable and comprehensive.

rate_limits.title: Rate Limits
rate_limits.description: Configure rate limits for API routes to prevent abuse.

global.title: Global Rate Limiting
global.description_enabled: Rate limiting is enabled globally. Individual routes can still be disabled.
global.description_disabled: Rate limiting is disabled globally. No rate limits will be applied.
global.status_description: Toggle standard rate limiting across the entire application.

routes.title: Route Configuration
routes.description: Manage rate limits for individual API routes.

messages.global_update_failed: Failed to update global rate limits.
messages.limit_required: At least one rate limit must be set when enabled.

pterodactyl_importer.title: Pterodactyl Importer
pterodactyl_importer.description: Seamlessly migrate your data from Pterodactyl to FeatherPanel. Follow the guide below to import your servers, users, and nodes.

toasts.failed_load_key: Failed to load API key details

prerequisites.title: System Requirements
prerequisites.description: Ensure your environment meets these criteria before starting the migration.
prerequisites.failed_desc: Please resolve the issues highlighted below.

step1.title: 1. Helper Installation
step1.description: Execute the following command to install the necessary migration tools:

step2.title: 2. Authentication
step2.description: Generate or select an API key to authorize the migration agent.

step3.title: 3. Configuration
step3.description: Initialize the CLI with your instance credentials:

help.title: Help & Support
help.description: Need help with the migration process? Check out our documentation or join our Discord community.

documentation.title: Migration Documentation
documentation.description: Complete guide and tutorial for migrating from Pterodactyl

discord.title: MythicalSystems Discord
discord.description: Get support from our community and team

info.title: Excluded Data
info.description: The following items are excluded from migration to ensure a clean import.
info.footer: Excluding this data significantly reduces migration time.

create_key.title: Create New API Key
create_key.description: Create a new API key for the Pterodactyl Migration Agent. This key will be used to authenticate the migration agent with your FeatherPanel instance.
create_key.help_text: Choose a descriptive name to identify this API key.
create_key.warning: Important: The private key will only be shown once when the API key is created. Make sure to copy it immediately as it cannot be retrieved later.

warning_dialog.title: Security Warning
warning_dialog.subtitle: Sensitive Information Exposure Risk
warning_dialog.desc: This page displays sensitive credentials (API Keys) that grant full administrative access to your panel. Exposure could lead to total system compromise.
warning_dialog.security_warning: ⚠️ ATTENTION: Close this page immediately if you are livestreaming or screen sharing.

database_management.title: Database Management
database_management.subtitle: Inspect database health, run migrations, and manage utilities

pma.confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete phpMyAdmin? This action cannot be undone.

what_is.title: What is this page?
what_is.description: View real-time database engine metrics and health status. Essential for diagnosing connectivity issues and monitoring performance.

metrics.title: Status & Metrics
metrics.description: Monitor key indicators like QPS, active threads, and network throughput. Use the refresh button to get the latest snapshot.

migrations.title: Migrations
migrations.description: Execute database schema updates when upgrading FeatherPanel or installing plugins. Always verify output logs.

safety.title: Safety & Backups
safety.description: Always backup your database before running migrations or major operations. FeatherPanel is not responsible for data loss due to unsafe operations.

node_databases.title: Node Databases
node_databases.description: These are databases that your users (clients) can create for their servers.
node_databases.search_placeholder: Search by name, host or username...

messages.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this database?

form.create_description: Add a new database to this node.
form.name: Database Name
form.host_help: Enter the hostname or IP address of the database server.

about_databases.title: About Databases
about_databases.description: These are databases that your users (clients) can create for their servers. Users can create multiple database types depending on the limits you set as the hosting owner. FeatherPanel supports a broad range of popular databases to fit many workloads.

plugins.title: Plugins
plugins.description: Manage installed plugins and their configurations

grid.empty_description: No plugins are currently installed on your system.
grid.author: Author

config.title: Plugin Configuration
config.no_schema: This plugin doesn't have a configuration schema defined
config.no_schema_desc: The plugin developer needs to add a config section to conf.yml

uninstall.title: Uninstall Plugin
uninstall.description: Are you sure you want to uninstall {plugin}?

install_url.title: Install From URL
install_url.warning: Warning: It is unsafe to install plugins from URLs that are not from the official repository.

upload.title: Upload and Install Plugin
upload.warning: Warning: Uploading and installing third-party plugins can be unsafe unless from our official repo.

update.title: Update Plugin
update.backup_warning: It's recommended to backup your plugin configuration and data before updating. The update will replace the current plugin files.

reinstall.title: Select Plugins to Reinstall
reinstall.description: Choose which previously installed plugins you would like to reinstall.

updates.title: Updates Available
updates.description: Hey! It looks like there is an update for the following plugins:

previously_installed.title: Previously Installed Plugins
previously_installed.description: You had {count} plugin(s) installed before. Would you like to reinstall them?

install.title: Install & Upload
install.description: Upload .fpa files via the GUI or install via a direct URL. Use the actions below to configure, export, or uninstall plugins.

config.title: Configuration
config.description: Click on any plugin card to configure its settings. Plugins may require specific configuration values to function properly.

security.title: Security & Liability
security.description: Installing third‑party plugins can be risky (panel corruption or system compromise). FeatherPanel and its team are not liable for what you install or develop.

redirect_links.title: Redirect Links
redirect_links.subtitle: Manage URL redirects for your system.

form.create_description: Create a new redirect link for your system.
form.edit_description: Edit details for the redirect link.
form.name: Name
form.slug_help: Leave empty to auto-generate from name.

messages.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this redirect link? This action cannot be undone.

what_is.title: What are Redirect Links?
what_is.description: Create short slugs that map to full URLs. Use paths like /discord to send users to your Discord, forum, status page, or any external resource.

nice_pages.title: Nice redirect pages
nice_pages.description: Visiting a slug displays a clean, animated redirect page before forwarding. It keeps links memorable and consistent across your brand.

translations.title: Translations
translations.subtitle: Manage translation files for your system.

form.language_code_help: ISO 639-1 language code (e.g., en, de, fr)
form.import_description: Import default English translations from frontend to backend.

messages.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this translation file? This action cannot be undone.
messages.import_failed: Failed to import default English translations.
messages.invalid_json: Invalid JSON format. Please check your syntax.

what_is.title: What are Translations?
what_is.description: Translation files allow you to provide your panel in multiple languages. Backend translations take priority over frontend translations.

fallback.title: Translation Fallback
fallback.description: If a translation key is missing in a language file, it will fallback to English, and then to frontend translations if still missing.

enabled.title: Enabled Languages
enabled.description: Manage which languages are available to users.

images.title: Images
images.subtitle: Manage uploaded images for your system.

form.create_description: Upload a new image to your system.
form.name: Name
form.file_help: Supported formats: JPG, PNG, GIF, WebP

messages.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this image? This action cannot be undone.
messages.fill_all: Please fill in all required fields.

upload.title: Upload & Reuse
upload.description: Upload images to use across the dashboard – e.g., for spells/eggs, banners, logos, or other UI assets you want to reference.

audit.title: Library & Audit
audit.description: This page is a central place to see what was uploaded to your host by users – like banners and other media – and manage them when needed.

realms.title: Realms
realms.subtitle: Manage all realms in your system

form.create_description: Fill in the details to create a new realm
form.name: Name

messages.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this realm?

what_are_realms.title: What are Realms?
what_are_realms.description: Realms are categories for your spells (known as 'eggs' in Pterodactyl's terms). Pterodactyl calls them nests; we call them realms because it's just better.

organize_spells.title: Organize your spells
organize_spells.description: Use realms as lightweight categories, similar to how locations group nodes. For example, a Minecraft realm contains Minecraft spells (eggs) like Paper, Vanilla, BungeeCord, and more.

spells.title: Spells
spells.subtitle: Manage all spells in your system
spells.search_placeholder: Search by name, description, or author...

form.create_description: Fill in the details to create a new spell
form.name: Name
form.author: Author

variables.title: Variables
variables.name: Name
variables.description: Configure environment variables for this spell
variables.help_text: Variables allow you to customize server behavior at creation time. Define defaults, validation rules, and user permissions for each variable.
variables.no_variables_help: Click 'Add Variable' to create your first variable
variables.field_types_info: Field Type: text, number, boolean, select, textarea

messages.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this spell?

cross_compatible.title: Cross-compatible spells
cross_compatible.description: Realms and spells are fully cross-compatible. We maintain a spells repository that works with both FeatherPanel and Pterodactyl, so you can fetch and use the same spells in either panel. You can also bring your own spells – import them here or host them in your own repo.

what_are_spells.title: What are Spells (eggs)?
what_are_spells.description: Spells are server templates that define runtime, Docker image, startup, features, configs, and scripts. They live inside realms (categories) and power server creation.

how_to_use.title: How you use them
how_to_use.description: Install/import a spell, pick a realm, then create servers from it. Spells can include update URLs, tags, banners, and author info for easy discovery and updates.

under_the_hood.title: Under the hood
under_the_hood.description: Configs (files/startup/logs/stop), file denylist, variables, Docker images, script container/entry, and optional privileged install scripts define behavior.

sources.title: Sources & compatibility
sources.description: Use our cross-compatible spells repo (FeatherPanel ↔ Pterodactyl) or bring your own JSON-defined spells. Import locally or host them in your own repository.

mail_templates.title: Mail Templates
mail_templates.subtitle: Manage email templates for your system.

form.create_description: Fill in the details to create a new email template.
form.mass_email_description: Create and send HTML emails to all users in your system.
form.name: Name
form.subject: Subject
form.html_help:
You can use HTML tags like

,

, , , , etc.

messages.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this template? This action cannot be undone.
messages.mass_email_queued: Mass email queued successfully! {count} emails queued.
messages.mass_email_warning: This will send emails to ALL users with valid email addresses in your system. Make sure your content is appropriate and test thoroughly before sending.

what_is.title: What are Mail Templates?
what_is.description: Reusable HTML email layouts for notifications, onboarding, invoices, and more.

mass_email.title: Mass Email
mass_email.description: Send an HTML email to all users. Use responsibly and ensure SMTP is configured.

legal.title: Legal & Compliance
legal.description: Update your Privacy Policy and Terms to reflect bulk messaging usage.

featherai_agent.title: FeatherCloud AI Agent
featherai_agent.subtitle: Configure and customize your AI chatbot assistant

config.title: Chatbot Configuration
config.subtitle: Configure and customize your AI chatbot assistant
config.enable_description: Enable or disable the AI chatbot feature for all users
config.ai_provider_description: Select the AI provider to use for chatbot responses
config.system_prompt_core_description: The core system prompt that defines the AI assistant's behavior and capabilities. This is read-only and loaded from the system configuration.
config.custom_system_prompt_description: Custom system prompt to prepend to all messages (max 1000 characters)
config.custom_user_prompt_description: User context prompt to append to all messages (max 1000 characters)
config.loading_settings_description: Please wait while we fetch your configuration...
config.load_failed_description: Unable to load chatbot settings. Please try again later.

subdomains.title: Global Subdomains
subdomains.description: Manage the global domains and their SRV mappings for the subdomain system.
subdomains.secretMaskedMessage: API key is encrypted and stored securely.
subdomains.cloudflareHint: This key is used to manage DNS records on your Cloudflare account.
subdomains.tutorialDescription: Follow these steps to integrate Cloudflare subdomains with your panel.

tutorialSteps.credentials: Configure your Cloudflare API credentials in the settings below.
tutorialSteps.domain: Add a new domain and provide its Cloudflare Account and Zone IDs.
tutorialSteps.mappings: Configure spell mappings to define how subdomains are routed.

subdomains.tutorialNote: Note: Ensure your Cloudflare API key is a Global API Key (not a new API token). You can get it from: https://dash.cloudflare.com/profile/api-tokens
subdomains.mappingsDescription: Configure spell routing rules and protocols for your domain.

dialogHelpSteps.domain: Use the root domain (e.g., example.com) that is managed in your Cloudflare account.
dialogHelpSteps.spell: Spells define the protocol and priority for different game types.
dialogHelpSteps.protocol: SRV records will be automatically created based on these settings.

subdomains.dialogHelpFootnote: Changes usually propagate across Cloudflare's edge network within seconds.
subdomains.drawerDescription: Configure the Cloudflare integration and SRV mappings for this domain.
subdomains.activeToggleHint: Inactive domains will not be available for new subdomain assignments.
subdomains.spellRequired: At least one spell mapping is required.
subdomains.domainDetailsDescription: Active subdomains currently assigned to servers under this domain.
subdomains.noSubdomains: No active subdomains found under this domain.

featherzerotrust.title: FeatherZeroTrust
featherzerotrust.description: Advanced threat detection and malicious file scanning for your infrastructure

scanner.selectServer: Please select at least one server

hashes.noHashesDesc: Add hashes manually or run a scan to populate the database
hashes.checkHashesDesc: Bulk check file signatures against known threats

messages.hashRequired: Hash and file name are required
messages.invalidHash: Invalid hash format. Must be a valid SHA-256 hash (64 hex characters)
messages.enterHashes: Please enter at least one hash

logs.emptyDescription: Cron job execution history will appear here once scans are performed.

messages.detailsFailed: Failed to fetch execution log details

config.title: Configuration
config.description: Configure scanning behavior and detection rules
config.systemEnabledDesc: Master toggle for all ZeroTrust features
config.maxJarSizeDesc: Threshold for suspicious small JAR files
config.discordWebhookDesc: Send real-time alerts to a Discord channel
config.ignoredExtensionsDesc: Comma-separated list of extensions to skip

redirect.subtitle: Please wait while we redirect you to your destination.
redirect.countdown: You will be redirected in {count} seconds to:

chatbot.title: FeatherPanel AI
chatbot.description: Your intelligent assistant for server management
chatbot.welcome: Hi {name}! 👋 I'm your FeatherPanel AI assistant. How can I help you manage your servers today?
chatbot.noConversationsDescription: Start a new chat to begin
chatbot.connectionError: Sorry, I encountered an error connecting to the AI service. Please try again.
